io.netty.handler.codec.spdy

Class SpdyFrameDecoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerAdapter
      • io.netty.channel.ChannelStateHandlerAdapter
        • io.netty.channel.ChannelInboundByteHandlerAdapter
          • io.netty.handler.codec.ByteToMessageDecoder
            • io.netty.handler.codec.spdy.SpdyFrameDecoder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler, ChannelInboundByteHandler, ChannelStateHandler

    public class SpdyFrameDecoder
extends ByteToMessageDecoder
    Decodes ByteBufs into SPDY Data and Control Frames.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface io.netty.channel.ChannelHandler

        ChannelHandler.Sharable

      Creates a new instance with the specified parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • decodeLast

        public Object decodeLast(ChannelHandlerContext ctx,
                ByteBuf in)
                  throws Exception
        Description copied from class: ByteToMessageDecoder
        Is called one last time when the ChannelHandlerContext goes in-active. Which means the ByteToMessageDecoder.channelInactive(ChannelHandlerContext) was triggered. By default this will just call ByteToMessageDecoder.decode(ChannelHandlerContext, ByteBuf) but sub-classes may override this for some special cleanup operation.
        Overrides:
        decodeLast in class ByteToMessageDecoder
        Throws:
        Exception

      • decode

        protected Object decode(ChannelHandlerContext ctx,
            ByteBuf buffer)
                 throws Exception
        Description copied from class: ByteToMessageDecoder
        Decode the from one ByteBuf to an other. This method will be called till either the input ByteBuf has nothing to read anymore, till nothing was read from the input ByteBuf or till this method returns null.
        Specified by:
        decode in class ByteToMessageDecoder
        Parameters:
        ctx - the ChannelHandlerContext which this ByteToByteDecoder belongs to
        buffer - the ByteBuf from which to read data
        Returns:
        message the message to which the content of the ByteBuf was decoded, or null if there was not enough data left in the ByteBuf to decode.
        Throws:
        Exception - is thrown if an error accour
